rev.comment: did some minor work on the "criticism" section, but the wording is still terrible

|accessdate=2011-05-18}}</ref> as well as [https://en.bitcoin.it/wiki/Spesmilo Spesmilo], a [[PySide]] interface more open to a diversity of users which can run independently of an external wallet.<ref>[https://en.bitcoin.it/wiki/Spesmilo Spesmilo, PySide Bitcoin client]</ref>

==Criticisms==
+
==Concerns==
â
As Bitcoin is nowhere near proven-technology status, some criticisms still need addressing.
+
As Bitcoin is still a new experiment without proven-technology status, some concerns have not yet been adressed.
===Unfair initial distribution===
===Unfair initial distribution===
Line 146: Line 146:
It is questionable if such a scheme will ever be accepted by latecomers. Alternative distribution proposals have been made.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.newbitcoin.org/documents/newbitcoin.pdf|title=New Bitcoin: An improved Peer-to-Peer Electronic Cash System|accessdate=14 June 2011|last=Mooij|first=Steven|date=7 June 2011}}</ref>
It is questionable if such a scheme will ever be accepted by latecomers. Alternative distribution proposals have been made.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.newbitcoin.org/documents/newbitcoin.pdf|title=New Bitcoin: An improved Peer-to-Peer Electronic Cash System|accessdate=14 June 2011|last=Mooij|first=Steven|date=7 June 2011}}</ref>
â
===Technical difficulty===
+
===Technical complexity===
Transactions are based on scripts that are contained inside the transactions and are to be executed to 'access the money'. While this increases flexibility of transactions, it does complicate the development of Bitcoin applications.{{Citation needed|date=June 2011}}
Transactions are based on scripts that are contained inside the transactions and are to be executed to 'access the money'. While this increases flexibility of transactions, it does complicate the development of Bitcoin applications.{{Citation needed|date=June 2011}}
